channel.title: Lifestyle on Zimeng Zhou's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Lifestyle on Zimeng Zhou's Website

item.title: About me
item.description: Hi I am Zimeng! For non-Chinese speakers, you can just call me Michelle. Thank you for visiting my website. I will give you s short introduction about me:) Born and raised in Chongqing China, I moved to Hong Kong for undergraduate study in Accounting and Finance, during which I had the chance to go to the University of Cambridge for a summer school program to study economics and literature and developed a genuine respect for the vibrancy and dynamics of the city of London.

item.title: Estimating Net Approval (approve-disapprove) for Donald Trump
item.description: Trump’s Approval Margins In this project, I will use the data from fivethirtyeight.com all polls that track the president’s approval to analyse Trumps’s approval margin. # Import approval polls data approval_polllist <- read_csv(here::here('static','data', 'approval_polllist.csv')) glimpse(approval_polllist) ## Rows: 15,619 ## Columns: 22 ## $ president <chr> "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump",... ## $ subgroup <chr> "All polls", "All polls", "All polls", "All pol... ## $ modeldate <chr> "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/20.

item.title: Compare the GDP Components in the US, Germany and India
item.description: GDP components over time and among countries In this project, I will use the data from the United Nations’ National Accounts Main Aggregates Database, which contains estimates of total GDP and its components for all countries from 1970 to today. I will look at how GDP and its components have changed over time, and compare different countries and how much each component contributes to that country’s GDP. The file I will work with is GDP and its breakdown at constant 2010 prices in US Dollars.

item.title: Relationship between the annual rates of firearm homicide and suicide among white men
item.description: Firearm homicide and suicide were strongly associated for white men #upload data cdc_males <- read_csv(here::here("data", "CDC_Males.csv")) glimpse(cdc_males) ## Rows: 104 ## Columns: 28 ## $ ST <chr> "AK", "AK", "AL", "AL", "AR", "AR", "AZ", "... ## $ State <chr> "Alaska", "Alaska", "Alabama", "Alabama", "... ## $ Population.Black <dbl> 153664, 153664, 5376635, 5376635, 1991165, ... ## $ Population.White <dbl> 2274605, 2274605, 14267619, 14267619, 97470... ## $ Deaths.homicide.Black <dbl> 23, NA, 183, 1812, 667, 90, 300, 40, 3712, .
